relation: I think it is very safe, police officers and staff constantly patrols the area.
A new beautiful gym is going to be open april 2014.
Cafeterias, Starbucks, Subway - you will have plenty to choose from. Very affordable too.

It is definitely a step up from high school, professors and tutors are always there to help you, but reading assigned books, attending classes, and studying is YOUR responsibility. Don't expect it to be a breeze.

A great place to be at. Clean, safe campus, a lot of places to study, friendly staff. Great library. Free tutoring. A lot of classes and times to choose from - will fit anyone's schedule. And if you'd prefer online classes - pretty much every subject is available for online studying.
pageTitle: Middle Georgia State College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {193271=A new beautiful gym is going to be open april 2014., 185770=I cant speak for Macon campus dorms but I did live in the Cochran campus dorms for 2 years back in 2002. Since then they have really upgraded and expanded., 276734=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 136584=Since I'm still just a freshman, I'm not very familiar with the traditions that Macon State has. In the Spring of 2013, Macon State will be called Middle Georgia State College. Hopefully we will have a real football team and much more! Pep Rallies will be a blast! Go Knights!, 185226=Cochran campus food was decent but this was back in 2002 when I was there. I cant speak for now. As far as the Warner Robins campus, I have used the cafe in the bookstore and I love their coffee. There is now the new cafe/lounge there too which is really nice.}
textBeforeTable: 10/02/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 6 out of 6 people found this review useful. 1 of 68 Chloe from Macon, GA Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Comments Great for these types of students I think that Macon is great for people in a 2 year program. By the time you finish, you should be ready to go to a University. Tips for prospective students Attend every class; it is good to start at a small college than a university because at a small college you can get the one on one relationship with your professor. At a university, you are only a number. Students that are coming to college right after high school should start off small, then work your way to the top. Bang for the buck The tuition is great here. The financial aid can help you with any problems you may have. Emergency loans are given if you do not have the money right away. Am enjoying being here Everyone in Macon State are friendly and they give you tips on what classes you should take for your profession. I live in the Residence Life and it is wonderful. Other colleges have freshman sleeping in traditional dorms, but in Macon State you can live in a apartment. I have my own room and bathroom it is a great place to live in. Am learning a
